Foreign diplomats visit Kumsusan Memorial Palace 
    Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- Officials in charge of cultural and friendly relations at embassies of different countries here yesterday visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace, where President Kim Il Sung lies in state for perpetuity, on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
 There they paid their deep respects to the president who made immortal contributions to developing friendly relationship among nations and realizing the human cause of independence.    
 Then they looked round orders and medals he received from different countries, the mourning hall, and a train and a car he used for field guidance and foreign tour and in the last period of his life.

Withdrawal of "joint land management plan" demanded 
     Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- The south headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification was reported to have released a statement on April 6, strongly demanding the withdrawal of the "joint land management plan."
 Charging that the South Korea-U.S. military alliance has entered the phase of strengthening all measures to keep the U.S. military bases in the Korean Peninsula for an indefinite period, the statement noted that the plan is aimed at the overall redeployment of U.S. forces for their permanent presence in the Korean Peninsula and the establishment of the MD.    
 Calling for driving the U.S. troops out of South Korea and reunifying the country by the concerted efforts of the Korean people through the implementation of the June 15 joint declaration, it stressed that cooperation between compatriots is the only way out for the Korean people.

Greetings to Portuguese prime minister
    Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- Hong Song Nam, premier of the DPRK cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Jose Manuel Durao Barroso upon his appointment as Portuguese prime minister.
 Extending congratulations to him on his appointment, the message sincerely wished him success in his responsible work.    
 Meanwhile, foreign minister Paek Nam Sun sent a similar message to Antonio Martins Da Cruz upon his appointment as foreign minister of Portugal.

articles.title: Talks held between delegations of WPK and BCP
Meeting held to vow loyalty
articles.content:
Talks held between delegations of WPK and BCP
    Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- Talks between the delegations of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the Brazilian Communist Party were held here today.
 At the talks both sides informed each other of their parties' activities and exchanged views on the need to develop the friendly ties between the two parties and a series of issues of mutual concern.    
 Present at the talks were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the WPK, and officials concerned and members of the delegation of the Brazilian Communist Party led by vice-president of its central committee Jose Reinaldo Carvalho.
